Krebs cycle involves breaking down glucose into pyruvate, generating NADH and FADH2, and then using those to create ATP and other molecules like acetyl-CoA, but no sugar is produced.

Anaerobic respiration includes fermentation and some aspects of the Krebs cycle, like the electron transport chain, but none of these processes produce sugar.
